newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Oil ADRs stronger in quiet market.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Oil ADRs stronger in quiet market.

text.p: Foreign oil companies' American Depositary Receipts were firm Monday in a quiet ADR market.

Traders said investors were awaiting the U.S. Consumer Price Index for March, due tomorrow, and semiconductor maker Intel Corp's first quarter earnings, due today after the markets' close at 1600 EDT/2000 GMT.
Royal Dutch Petroleum Co rose 1-1/8 to 169-1/2 and Shell Transport and Trading Co Plc was unchanged at 102-3/8. French companies Elf Aquitaine rose 1/4 to 45-7/8 and Total SA was up 1/8 to 40.
The rises represented a rebound after recent selling in the sector, traders said.
Franco-Italian semiconductor maker SGS-Thomson Microelectronics NV fell one to 64-1/2 after reporting sharply lower first quarter earnings.
Irish software company CBT Group Plc fell 2-1/2 to 44-1/4 after reporting first quarter earnings per ADR of $0.14, up from $0.10 a year earlier.
Among Latin American ADRs, Chilean issues were firmer on the back of an interest rate cut announced Friday. Compania Telecomunicaciones de Chile rose 1/8 to 29-3/4.
Decliners led advancers 251 to 174 among 806 ADRs. The ADR index was off 0.20 percent in late-morning trade and volume was a light 19.3 million shares.
